Blak-blakan Wamen Agraria
Surya Tjandra, Dulu Bela Buruh Kini Tangani Konflik Agraria
04 Nov 2019 by Sudrajat


Wakil Menteri Agraria dan Tata Ruang, Surya Tjandra. Foto: Screenshoot 20detik

Jakarta - Bertahun-tahun Surya Tjandra dikenal sebagai pengacara publik yang banyak memperjuangkan hak-hak buruh. Toh begitu dia merasa dirinya tetap cocok mengemban tugas sebagai Wakil Menteri Agraria dan Tata Ruang, bukan Wakil atau Menteri yang mengurusi ketenagakerjaan. Sebab dia tetap memiliki bekal ilmu hukum yang memadai, juga pengalamannya dalam berinteraksi dengan masyarakat kecil.

[Gambas:Video 20detik]

Semua itu akan membuatnya lebih mudah dalam memahami dan memetakan persoalan sekaligus membuat alternatif solusinya. Surya mengaku sebagai pribadi yang sensitif sehingga tidak merasa khawatir untuk bertemu masyarakat."Sebab yang dibutuhkan (masyarakat) kan sebetulnya pemerintah itu menyapa, mendengarkan (keluh-kesah masyarakat) sehingga mereka percaya bahwa pemerintah ini berbuat yang benar," kata Surya kepada Tim Blak-blakan detikcom.Saat awal berkiprah di LBH dan menjadi pengacara publik, dia mengaku selalu apriori dan menilai pemerintah selalu salah. Tapi berbagai persoalan yang ditemui di lapangan membuat dia akhirnya paham bahwa dalam kasus tertentu sebetulnya masyarakat juga bisa salah.Dalam sebuah kebijakan publik, kata Surya, tidak mungkin kebijakan publik akan memuaskan semuanya."Pasti ada korbannya, pasti ada yang dirugikan. Kita bisa pakai Prinsip Pareto (ekonom Italia Vilfredo Pareto) selama 80% oke berarti oke. Sisanya yang 20% adalah yang dirugikan," ujarnya.Menyadari hal itu lalu pemerintah bisa fokus untuk memberikan mitigasi terhadap para korban. "Saya punya passion di situ, seperti dalam menangani konflik agraria."Saat memintanya menjadi wakil menteri, Presiden Jokowi menugaskan agar dia membantu menyelesaikan berbagai masalah pertanahan, seperti tumpang tindih kepemilikan tanah, sertifikasi, konflik agraria, masyarakat yang tinggal di hutan, dan reformasi agraria.Surya lahir di Jakarta pada 28 Maret 1971. Kedua orang tuanya adalah pedagang ayam potong di Pasar Jatinegara. Anak keenam dari tujuh bersaudara ini semula bercita-cita menjadi Insinyur Penerbangan. Tapi karena program beasiswa sudah dihentikan akhirnya dia memilih kuliah di Fakultas Hukum UI. Pertimbangannya, biaya kuliah relatif lebih murah dan tingkat persaingan tidak terlalu tinggi.Selepas dari UI dia aktif di LBH Jakarta. Dari situ dia melanjutkan pendidikan ilmu hukumnya di Universitas Warwick - London, dan Universitas Leiden, Belanda.Selain berbicara soal komitmennya untuk membantu mencari alternatif terbaik dalam menangani isu agraria, dia juga mengungkapkan kekagumannya terhadap sosok Menteri Agraria dan Tata Ruang Sofyan A Djalil. Dia juga dengan lugas mengungkapkan kondisi keluarga dan perjalanan hidupnya sebagai penyandang disabilitas sejak usia 6 bulan.Penasaran seperti apa? Simak Blak-blakan Wakil Menteri Agraria dan Tata Ruang Surya Tjandra, "Bela Buruh dan Konflik Agraria" di detikcom, Senin (4/11/2019).(jat/ang)

Outspoken Agrarian Wamen
Surya Tjandra, Labor Defenders Now Handle Agrarian Conflict
Nov 04 2019 by Sudrajat


Deputy Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning, Surya Tjandra. Photo: Screenshot 20 seconds

Jakarta - For years Surya Tjandra has been known as a public lawyer who fights for labor rights. After all, he felt he was still fit to carry out his duties as Deputy Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning, not the Deputy or Minister in charge of manpower. Because he still has adequate legal knowledge, as well as his experience in interacting with small communities.

[Gambas: 20sec video]

All of that will make it easier to understand and map problems while creating alternative solutions. Surya claims to be a sensitive person so that he does not feel worried to meet the community. "Because what is needed (the community) is actually the government greeting, listening (community complaints) so they believe that this government is doing the right thing," Surya told the Blak Team -bakan detikcom. When he first started working at LBH and became a public lawyer, he claimed he was always a priori and considered the government always wrong. But various problems encountered in the field made him finally understand that in certain cases the community could actually be mistaken. In a public policy, said Surya, it is impossible that public policy will satisfy all of them. "There must be victims, there must be harmed. We can use The Pareto principle (Italian economist Vilfredo Pareto) as long as 80% is okay means okay. The remaining 20% is the ones who are disadvantaged, "he said. Realizing that the government could then focus on providing mitigation to the victims. "I have a passion there, as in dealing with agrarian conflicts." When asking him to become a deputy minister, President Jokowi assigned him to help resolve various land issues, such as overlapping land ownership, certification, agrarian conflicts, forest-dwelling people, and reforms. agraria.Surya was born in Jakarta on March 28, 1971. Both of her parents are broiler chickens in Jatinegara Market. The sixth child of seven siblings originally aspired to become an Aviation Engineer. But because the scholarship program was stopped he finally chose to study at the Faculty of Law UI. The consideration is that tuition fees are relatively cheaper and the level of competition is not too high. After UI, he was active at LBH Jakarta. From there he continued his legal education at the University of Warwick - London, and Leiden University, the Netherlands. In addition to talking about his commitment to help find the best alternative in dealing with agrarian issues, he also expressed his admiration for the figure of the Minister of Agrarian and Spatial Planning Sofyan A Djalil. He also bluntly revealed the condition of his family and his life journey as a person with disabilities since the age of 6 months. What kind of curiosity? Listen Bluntly Deputy Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Solar Spatial Planning Tjandra, "Defending Labor and Agrarian Conflict" at detikcom, Monday (11/04/2019). (Jat / ang)
